text: John II (; 26 April 1319 – 8 April 1364), called John the Good (French: Jean le Bon), was a monarch of the House of Valois who ruled as King of France from 1350 until his death.Père Anselme, Histoire généalogique et chronologique de la Maison royale de France, des Pairs, grands Officiers de la Couronne et de la Maison du Roy... , 3e édition, Compagnie des Libraires, Paris, 1726, p. 105 John II was succeeded by his son, Charles, who reigned as Charles V of France, known as The Wise. ==References== Category:1319 births Category:1364 deaths Category:Kings of France Category:French prisoners of war in the Hundred Years' War
title: John II of France
